alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Sitka (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 14 at 7:49PM AKDT until September 16 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The Indian River near Sitka including within The National Park. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM AKDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 744 PM AKDT, Satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected, especially near the Indian River. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.1-0.2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of up to around 1 inch inch are possible. - For Indian River at Sitka: At 7:15pm the stage was 24.14 feet. Flood Stage is 25.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 23.16 feet is expected around 8:00pm Thursday. Impacts: At 25.5 feet: Water will begin to flood the National Park Service`s bridge near Sawmill Creek road along with the trail system in the park near the river. Other places in the Sitka area will also begin to see minor flooding issues. - If you live near or along the Indian River stay alert and be prepared to take action. - All residents on or near mountain slopes should be prepared for possible landslides.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
